Text: Great torrent, but perhaps you should superseed it if you have a slow connection? 50 mb in two days means that it will take appr. three months to finish it at this rate. :)

I've been superseeding it ("initial-seeding" set on utorrent) all along. The problem is a slow connection in my area - up speed averages at 25kb/s.

But even though I've uploaded over 760MB till now, utorrent shows an availability of 1.04. :[

Seems to be a bug with utorrent or some exotic virus: I started off seeding 100%, but a few days later a couple of the mp3 files disappeared from my hard disk and I was left with 95%. A week later, more files had disappeared and it was down to 85%. Anyway, got my hands on a backup which I'll chuck into the bermuda triangle to start seeding 100% again.
Ok, I'm seeding again :]

Hmm, just finished downloading it, and like more then 50% of the files are ".bc!" format. What is this? :P Never seen it before, and neither has my mp3... Whats going on? And is there some sort of converting program for this? Thanks.

Assuming you're using BitComet, those .bc! files are incomplete download files generated by that program. This means your torrent hasn't actually finished downloading. Raise this issue with BitComet or use another client instead, like uTorrent.
